retrievedObjects.title: prescriptions
retrievedObjects.content:
prescriptions
 i went to the dr last week and she prescribed differin gel, but i had some complications w/ my insurance so i havent filled the differin gel yet, but prior to this i was on clindamycin topical for 4 yrs and my face was crytal clear then about a yr and a 1/2 ago it stopped working. so last week my face looked really bad because of that time of the month so i decided to start using my clindamycin again that i had left over. this week my face is really improving. could the imunity to the clindamycin have worn off? if the clindamycin can work again i really dont want to use the differin gel how should i go about telling my dr about this? should i call and tell the nurse? i go back in month.....my daily rountine for about a week: morning: wash cetaphil neutrogena multi-vitamin lotion clindamycin applied to a q-tip then apllied to the face nite: same as morning if i wear foundation i use my neutrogena oil free cleanser w/ salicyic acid. anyone have any suggestions about the clindamycin? thanx

retrievedObjects.title: Clindamycin Phosphate, why do dermatologists recommend it. Its horrible.
retrievedObjects.content:
Clindamycin Phosphate, why do dermatologists recommend it. Its horrible.
 I had this really bad pimple on my forehead. My dermatologist recommended I use Clindamycin Phosphate topical solution. This is a pad you put on your face You put the pad on the acne for 15 minutes twice a day. This is the absolute worst acne product. When the pimple would go down, it would dent and peel my skin. It totally messed up my skin. Now the area where it dented and peeled my skin, that skin is not growing back. I would stay away from the Clindamycin Phosphate. I might have to get a Collagen implant. First i'm gonna try using moisturizers to see if that will help.

retrievedObjects.content:
Azelex, clindamycin, doxycycline
 have anyone used or are using any one of these acne products to treat acne vulgaris: Azelex Cream Clindamycin phosphate topical solution Doxycycline antibiotic????? If you have or know someone who has please share your story. I'm currently on them and would like to hear other pplz stories.... thanx

retrievedObjects.title: Clindamycin Phosphate Topical Solution
retrievedObjects.content:
Clindamycin Phosphate Topical Solution
 I was wondering if anyone has used Clindamycin Phosphate Topical Solution, USP 1%. I just got on it and since I never heard of it before I was curious about how effective it is. Also if it is bad to also use Tazorac at the same time.

retrievedObjects.title: Retin-A + Clindamycin lotion + Minocycline
retrievedObjects.content:
Retin-A + Clindamycin lotion + Minocycline
 I've been using Retin-A 0.025% cream + doxycyline for over a year. I went to the derm, and he gave me Clindamycin lotion + Minocycline to take instead of the Doxy. Anyone have any experiences with this combo? I'd love to hear about how they worked. Thanks! :)

retrievedObjects.title: How do i get rid of permanent acne (disgusting details)?
retrievedObjects.content:
How do i get rid of permanent acne (disgusting details)?
 i have 4 acne pimples on my chest as a result of puberty, but its been a while now and i have noticed i am no longer getting as much acne around my face and body as i used to. these pimples were probably at one time regular pimples, but i pestered, squeezed, and attacked these pimples before their due dates. now ive had these 4 chest acne for months now and i want to know how to remove them short of me having to cut them off. i have tried acne medication in walmart like neutrogena. no work.

retrievedObjects.title: Like Clindamycin?
retrievedObjects.content:
Like Clindamycin?
 Hey Everyone, I was just thinking, out of all the stuff i've tried for my problematic skin Clindamycin Topical Solution was probably the most effective for the longest time. However, eventually, it wore off. I still use it, but its no way as effective as before. So, i was wondering, is there anything else like Clindamycin Topical Solution that i could try? I can't use Zineryt as i have bad reactions to Erythromycin. Any ideas anyone? Also, i have this pimple on my forehead, under my skin, hardly visible... just a small light red patch. Wouldn't normally be that much of a problem, but it really f***ing hurts! Its been there for a couple of days no so hopefulyl its days are now numbered, but anyone got any tips on helping it move any quicker? Thanks in advance, Chester x

retrievedObjects.title: going to derm tomorrow, what do u reccommend?
retrievedObjects.content:
going to derm tomorrow, what do u reccommend?
 i deseperately need something to get rid of this terrible disease. It is destroying my self esteem in immeasurable degrees. I cannot deal with it any more. Im going to college next year and I would very much like to leave this chapter in my life behind. What do u guys suggest I go on(besides accutane)?

retrievedObjects.title: Bactrim &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; Differin CREAM
retrievedObjects.content:
Bactrim &amp;amp;amp;amp;amp; Differin CREAM
 I am 26 and have had problems with acne for many years. My dermatologist prescribed me both Bactrim Differin Cream (not gel). I was on Retin A Cream(a low % dose - .025%) and Minocycline however I went to see her today and I had some bad pimples and she thought we should switch it up. I should mention that I do get breakout�s here and there but I do not consider it severe acne. I do get some bad pimples at least once a month and they take forever to go away (and stay very red in area�s). Anyways, I wanted to get feedback on both Bactrim Differin and if anyone has used them together??? I did read some bad feedback on Bactrim and that it�s a very strong antibiotic (and some people have had bad side effects). I know its bad to be on antibiotics for a long period of time so I am nervous to go on this one given its stronger. What is consider a long time??? I was on spironolatcote but that messed with my libido so I switched and was put on minocyline and now bactrim. Please let me know your thoughts, advice, feedback!!! Thanks!!!

retrievedObjects.title: Clindamycin?
retrievedObjects.content:
Clindamycin?
 Hey everyone. Just was prescribed topical clindamycin yesterday. Has anyone used this? According to ****pedia, it's used for severe acne. I don't think I'm severe, I have about 2-3 cysts at any given time on my chin. But I'd be interested to know if anyone has had success with this, what side effects there were (is it really drying, etc), will it help with blackheads, etc. The doctor just said it would work well for me when I asked him to prescribe something topical for my acne. He didn't give me any specifics. Thanks!

retrievedObjects.title: acne only on face at age 40 on shaving area?
retrievedObjects.content:
acne only on face at age 40 on shaving area?
 Hi I am male 40+ having healthy and clean lifestyle.since age 21 i having acne only on shaving area on face. in first week of every pimple its get red for 2 weeks then it turns yellow then gorw with puss in it then swollen thenn lot of pain then burst, is going on last 20 years. Having all treatments and specialist in Australia and India, No result. Took ROACCUTANE 2 YEARS BEFORE BUT SUPRESS FOR A YEAR THEN START AGAIN. All specialist says there is no cure,its sebum, its harmone, you are one of those.,all thats conclusion. Could you pull me out this, its ruin my whole life. Pl advice me.

retrievedObjects.content:
Has anyone used Clindamycin topical solution?
 I was just prescribed this for acne on the top of my legs. I m supposed to put it on once a day. I'm wondering if I should be using this at night or during the day. If anyone has usec this I'd like to hear your suggestions. Thanks

retrievedObjects.title: Anyone else here not happy with Cleocin? (Clindamycin)
retrievedObjects.content:
Anyone else here not happy with Cleocin? (Clindamycin)
 I've been taking doryx (this is my second round) along with putting tazorac cream on my face in the evening and clindamycin during the day. I really dont like the clindamycin.. it make my face so oily and I feel like it does nothing. So, Ive been just using the tazorac at night, which is givng me good results. Anyone have any other suggestions for a day topical cream? Thanks!!

retrievedObjects.title: oxytetracyline tablets
retrievedObjects.content:
oxytetracyline tablets
 Anyone esle had these? After a month of using clindamycin gel my GP has given me the titled tablets. The clindamycin gel, for anyone thats interested worked a little, it definatly got rid of the dark redness of the spots and reduced the amount of breakouts so I'm left with scars mainly now. So hopefully the tablets and continuing to use the gel should reduce it anymore, but what are people's opinions on just the tablets (unless anyone else is using both exactly the same as me?) thanks :)

retrievedObjects.title: gentle drugstore cleanser recs??
retrievedObjects.content:
gentle drugstore cleanser recs??
 Hi guys! I usually use Clean and Clear Continuous Control Acne cleanser daily, but now I am using clindamycin at night so i am getting pretty dry. I don't want to get too dry because I hear that can produce more oil. Any recs on a gentle drugstore cleanser (preferably fragarance free) I have sensitive skin, that I can use on days I use clindamycin?? Thanks for all your help!

retrievedObjects.title: Plexion??
retrievedObjects.content:
Plexion??
 My derm. prescribed me Yasmin, Clindamycin, and Plexion cleanser. The yasmin made me extremely ill and I broke out in a rash..so I quit using the clindamycin until I made sure the rash was from the yasmin instead of it. I haven't bought the Plexion yet bc I don't have prescription coverage and it was almost 150 for a bottle. I wanted to know if anyone had used this wash for acne, if you liked the product, and how long it took to see results?! Thanks!

retrievedObjects.title: Clindamycin resistance
retrievedObjects.content:
Clindamycin resistance
 Does anybody have an opinion on this? Originally duac and differin cleared me up 100% for 9 months, but then when the breakouts came back the derm switched me off the differin but kept the duac. I've tried klaron, retin-a at night but nothings helping. Now the derm has me using azelic acid at night along with just clindagel (same as duac minus the bp). So basically I've been using clindamycin for 2 years now. I searched the web and found a number of reputable sites/studies that found clindamycin resistance after prolonged use. So why wouldn't my derm know that?!? Anybody??
